stem: Given question: Where can someone view a county highway as a line? and answer: map, explain why in
no_more_50_words: The only context in which an entire county road could be represented meaningfully as a single line would be on a map, e.g., a map of roads in the county, or a GPS application on a smartphone.
50_to_100_words: A county highway can be viewed as a line on a map because maps use lines to represent features such as roads, rivers, and political boundaries. The line for a county highway on a map typically represents the physical path of the road and its location in relation to other features such as cities, towns, and natural landmarks. County highways are usually distinguished by their different colors, width, or other styles on the map. This representation of county highway as a line on a map helps user to locate and identify different routes, plan their journey and have a better understanding of the road network on a given area.
